intro: Spigelia valenzuelae var. major, commonly known as the Valenzuela's spigelia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, red-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
